item.title: Differentiation
item.description: Introduction Consider a function (f(x)) represented by the curve in Figure 1. The derivative of $f(x)$ at a point $x=x_0$, denoted by $f’(x_0)$, is the slope of the tangent line to the graph of $f(x)$ at the point $(x_0, f(x_0))$. A tangent line is the limit of the secant lines joining points $P=(x_0, f(x_0))$ and $Q$ on the graph of $f(x)$ as $Q$ approaches $Pâ€‹$. A graph with secant and tangent lines (left).
